question: Which sea houses the "Archipelago Sea"?
explanation: The Archipelago Sea is a part of the Baltic Sea between the Gulf of Bothnia, the Gulf of Finland, and the Sea of Aland, located within the territorial waters of Finland. It contains the largest archipelago in the world by the number of islands. Aland Islands, which is an autonomous region of Finland, is located in this Sea. It is one of the tourist destinations of Finland.
